content.description: Starts up Crack Route, at the horizontal crack, veer right into the dihedral to find good holds and smears to step up into a stance before the crux. Potential knee bar here. Make moves and gastons to meet back up with the crack finish from Crack Route.
content.protection: TR. Small gear works well if setting plum for this line.
content.location: Starts up Crack Route, easy ramp moves up to the split.

content.description: Avoid using the cheat block behind you. Start up and enter crux off a crimp and smears to get on easier ground and walk it up to a nice step to finish.
content.protection: TR. 2 and 3 C4 in wide crack, .5 C4 underneath block.
content.location: StartsÂ  left most, up a small depression staying to the right of the groove and vegetation.

content.description: Starts from Obvious route, following the horizontal, snaking crack; but rather continue around and up the flaring crack to the finish. The transition around the corner up into the flare is likely the crux.
content.protection: .3-3 and maybe some smaller if you want to protect the flare on lead.
content.location: Starts up Obvious Route, far right. Juts up and to the right following a flaring crack/angle to the finish.

content.description:
Route follow obvious crack that snakes across formation.

Start right most between the rocks (potential crux) continuing up and traversing left to gain good holds and finding feet to turn the corner and continue traversing left to the end of the system and taking the small crack ramp up.
content.location: Starts most right and low of formation, traversing easy ground, and finish up and left.

content.description: Hidden hold to mantle up the easyramp to the crack. Utilizing the corner some to get the crimps and get established on the face. Small crystals, sequential smearing and crimp cranking achieve more thin holds to gain the low angle finish.
content.protection: TR gear anchor. Scramble up climber's right.
content.location: Follow depression/cracks on ramp up to crack in middle of formation continuing up the face.

content.description: Starts below large bulge on upper part of formation. Quick step up mantle to the ramp (optional small pro) leads up to the crack. Good holds and tight feet get you through the crux to stand on a small ledge. Continue up the crack to the low angle finish.
content.protection: 1 and 3 C4, black alien, optional other small pro potential
content.location: Start below the bulge up the ramp and through the crux sequences on the upper face.
